trans-unit.source: Provides the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref> class and the <xref href="System.Web.UI.UserControl"></xref> class with a base set of functionality.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class is an abstract class that provides common properties and methods for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class and the <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> class.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> is not created directly.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class defines methods supporting declarative data-binding expressions:
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Eval%2A> method for data-binding expression involving data sources, such as simple properties or expressions.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method for parsing and evaluating an XPath data-binding expression.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPathSelect%2A> method for data-binding against an expression containing an XPath select statement.
The result is a node collection that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.

For more information on data-binding expression, see [Data-Binding Expression Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/676beb1d-ddfa-4153-bba8-3c86dcb7ceca) and [Binding to Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ab7b2846-975b-4057-a948-45527497c742).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not called directly.
Occurs when a user ends a transaction.
Gets or sets the application-relative, virtual directory path to the file from which the control is parsed and compiled.

When the file that defines a <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> control resides in a directory other than that of the page processing the request, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.AppRelativeVirtualPath%2A> property to return the application-relative, virtual path to the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AppRelativeTemplateSourceDirectory%2A> property is set based on the virtual path that is set in the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.AppRelativeVirtualPath%2A> property.
A string representing the path.
The path that is set is `null`.
The path that is set is not rooted.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.AutoHandlers"></xref> property has been deprecated in ASP.NET NET 2.0.
It is used by generated classes and is not intended for use within your code.
Always 0.
Occurs when a transaction completes.
Performs design-time logic.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Construct%2A> method allows design-time code execution of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> and <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> controls.
Accesses literal strings stored in a resource.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.CreateResourceBasedLiteralControl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)"></xref> method is not intended for use from within your code.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.CreateResourceBasedLiteralControl%2A> method is used to access literal strings that are stored in a resource and is not intended for use from within your code.
The offset of the start of the string in the resource.
The size of the string in bytes.
A Boolean value indicating if the string in the resource contains only 7-bit ASCII characters.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.LiteralControl"></xref> representing a literal string in a resource.
Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether themes apply to the control that is derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.EnableTheming%2A> property indicates whether themes are enabled for the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.EnableTheming%2A> property is `true`, the theme directory for the application is searched for control skins to apply.
If no skin for the particular control exists in the theme directory, skins are not applied.
`true` to use themes; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when an unhandled exception is thrown.
Evaluates a data-binding expression.
The value of `expression` must evaluate to a public property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Eval%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The navigation path from the container to the public property value to place in the bound control property.
An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.
The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
expression is `null`.
\- or -
expression is an empty string ("").
Evaluates a data-binding expression using the specified format string to display the result.
The value of `expression` must evaluate to a public property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Eval%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinder.Eval%2A> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The navigation path from the container to the public property value to place in the bound control property.
A .NET Framework format string to apply to the result.
A string that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.
The data-binding method can only be used for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
expression is `null`.
\- or -
expression is an empty string ("").
Initializes the control that is derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl"></xref> class.
Do not override the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.FrameworkInitialize%2A> method.

Gets an application-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties.
Application-level resources are stored in the App_GlobalResources folder.
For more information, see [Resources in ASP.NET Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5a29f26b-d94d-48d9-864e-5ee8890dc265).
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref>.
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref>.
An object representing the requested resource object; otherwise, `null`.

Gets an application-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties, object type, and property name of the resource.
Application-level resources are stored in the App_GlobalResources folder.
For more information, see [Resources in ASP.NET Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5a29f26b-d94d-48d9-864e-5ee8890dc265).
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref>.
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref>.
The type of object in the resource to get.
The property name of the object to get.
An object representing the requested resource object; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a page-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property.
Local resource files are stored in the App_LocalResources directory.
For more information, see [Resources in ASP.NET Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5a29f26b-d94d-48d9-864e-5ee8890dc265)
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref>.
An object representing the requested resource object; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a page-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property, object type, and property name.
Local resource files are stored in the App_LocalResources directory.
For more information, see [Resources in ASP.NET Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5a29f26b-d94d-48d9-864e-5ee8890dc265)
A string representing a <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref>.
The type of the resource object to get.
The property name of the resource object to get.
An object representing the requested resource object; otherwise, `null`.
Loads a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object from a file based on a specified virtual path.

If the control supports caching, the object returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.LoadControl%2A> method is not actually a <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> object; rather, it is a <xref:System.Web.UI.PartialCachingControl> object.
If the `virtualPath` parameter is relative, the path of the loaded control is relative to the path of the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl>.
When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event.
However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing.

For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event rather than in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Load> event.
The virtual path to a control file.
Returns the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref>.
The virtual path is `null` or empty.
Loads a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object based on a specified type and constructor parameters.

If the user control supports caching, the object returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.LoadControl%2A> method is not actually a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> object; rather, it is a <xref:System.Web.UI.PartialCachingControl> object.
When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event.
However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing.

For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event rather than in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Load> event.
The type of the control.
An array of arguments that match in number, order, and type the parameters of the constructor to invoke.
If parameters is an empty array or `null`, the constructor that takes no parameters (the default constructor) is invoked.
Returns the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.UserControl"></xref>.
Obtains an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> interface from an external file.
The virtual path to a user control file.
An instance of the specified template.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.AbortTransaction"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.CommitTransaction"></xref> event.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.OnCommitTransaction%2A> method for any transaction processing logic in which your page or user control participates.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Error"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Parses an input string into a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object on the Web Forms page or user control.
The `content` parameter contains a user control, such as you would find in an .ascx file.
This string cannot contain any code, because the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ParseControl%2A> method never causes compilation.
A string that contains a user control.
The parsed <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref>.
Parses an input string into a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> object on the ASP.NET Web page or user control.
The `content` parameter contains a user control (the contents of an .ascx file).
This string cannot contain any code, because the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ParseControl%2A> method never causes compilation.
The `ignoreParserFilter` parameter allows the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class to be ignored.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class is used by the ASP.NET parser to determine whether an item is allowed in the page at parse time.
A string that contains a user control.
A value that specifies whether to ignore the parser filter.
The parsed control.
Reads a string resource.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ReadStringResource"></xref> method is not intended for use from within your code.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ReadStringResource%2A> method is not intended for use from within your code.
An object representing the resource.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ReadStringResource"></xref> is no longer supported.
Reads a string resource.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ReadStringResource(System.Type)"></xref> method is not intended for use from within your code.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ReadStringResource%2A> method is not intended for use from within your code.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the resource to read.
An object representing the resource.
Sets a pointer to a string resource.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.SetStringResourcePointer(System.Object,System.Int32)"></xref> method is used by generated classes and is not intended for use from within your code.
An object representing the pointer to the string resource.
The resource size.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl"></xref> control supports automatic events.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.SupportAutoEvents%2A> property indicates whether automatic events are supported.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.SupportAutoEvents%2A> property is read-only and is `true` for all cases.
Always `true`.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a device filter applies to the HTTP request.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.TestDeviceFilter%2A> method invokes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.IsBrowser%2A> method.
For more information on device filtering, see [Device Filtering Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bdfeaa58-dedd-4c0d-8610-988aac0eff19).
The browser name to test.
`true` if the client browser specified in filterName is the same as the specified browser; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Writes a resource string to an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> control.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.WriteUTF8ResourceString(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)"></xref> method is used by generated classes and is not intended for use from within your code.
The control to write to.
The starting position within value.
The number of characters within value to use.
`true` to bypass re-encoding; otherwise, `false`.
Data that is not valid is being accessed; offset or size is less than zero.
\- or -
The sum of offset and size is greater than the resource size.
Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression using the specified prefix and namespace mappings for namespace resolution and the specified format string to display the result.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
A .NET Framework format string to apply to the result.
A set of prefix and namespace mappings used for namespace resolution.
A string that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.
The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression using the specified prefix and namespace mappings for namespace resolution.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
A set of prefix and namespace mappings used for namespace resolution.
An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.
The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.
The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression using the specified format string to display the result.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
A .NET Framework format string to apply to the result.
A string that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.
The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.

Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression using the specified prefix and namespace mappings for namespace resolution and returns a node collection that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> interface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPathSelect%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Select%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
A set of prefix and namespace mappings used for namespace resolution.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> node list.
Evaluates an XPath data-binding expression and returns a node collection that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> interface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPathSelect%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Select%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
The XPath expression to evaluate.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.XPathBinder"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> node list.
Returns a value that indicates whether a parent/child relationship exists between two specified device filters.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IFilterResolutionService%23CompareFilters%2A> method is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment.

When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.
A device filter name.
A device filter name.
1, if filter1 is a parent of filter2; -1, if filter2 is a parent of filter1; otherwise, 0, if there is no parent/child relationship between filter1 and filter2.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified filter is a type of the current filter object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.System%23Web%23UI%23IFilterResolutionService%23EvaluateFilter%2A> method is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment.

When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.
The name of a device filter.
`true` if the specified filter is a type applicable to the current filter object; otherwise, `false`.
